10001.description: About the Institute The Institute for Immigrant Concerns (http://http://instituteforimmigrantconcerns.com/) is committed to equipping immigrant communities city-wide with English skills, computer training, job readiness, and referalls for social services. The Institute empowers immigrant families and communities in their quest for social and economic independence. To reach immigrants the Institute operates across New York City and frequently collaborates with other community groups. Our staff is as diverse as our clients and draws on talented individuals to create a powerful, sustainable impact in America's newest immigrants. Job Description The Bilingual Administrative Assistant is essential to maintaining an efficient office environment in support of Institute programs, staff, and volunteers. This position will be responsible for general office administration, organizing office resources, coordination of program activities, and program management support. This is an ideal position for those seeking administrative experience at a busy Manhattan non-profit. This program welcomes retired professionals. Though this position is primarily administrative, it presents an opportunity to get an introduction to non-profit management. Requirements: Commitment to work 3 months minimum Bilingual oral and written skills, preferably Russian but other languages welcome Excellent written and oral communication Knowledge of foreign languages Proficiency in MS Office and Excel Ability to work independently and alongside a team of staff and volunteers with a passion for immigrant empowerment Ability to work in a multi-cultural environment This internship is unpaid, but college credit may be available.

10001.description: MARKETING AND COMMUNICATIONS INTERN We are seeking an excellent communicator, writer, and avid social media user as a Marketing and Communications intern to support public relations, marketing, blog and social media for Global Goods Partners. Social Media and Web Responsibilities: Create content to grow the organization’s footprint, including social media and blog posts Research current artisan partners and product, maintain sample inventory Expand and maintain GGP’s social networking and online presence to promote GGP products, fundraising efforts, and stories of women artisan partners around the world. Create compelling narratives about GGP’s partners and work around the world. Research and update country and partner information currently on the website. Craft descriptive and appealing product descriptions for the website. the website. Craft descriptive and appealing product descriptions for the website. PR and Events Responsibilities: Connect with influential media outlets and journalists to place stories about company news, relevant holidays, and collections Outreach to potential media partners with pitches, press releases and curated line sheets Actively pursue permanent links on like-minded sites, and assist with implementing social media strategy. Organize events designed to engage our target market. Develop and enact a strategy for digital communications with consumers and other key stakeholders to include artisan stories, product information, and resources. Personal Requirements: Excellent research, communication and writing skills Proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint Experience with social media, blogging and creating public relations campaigns Interest in and knowledge of fair trade and ethical business Able to commit to 2-3 days per week during the summer college break Specific Qualifications (a plus but not necessary): Experience in creating and implementing public relations campaigns, including familiarity with print and online media Proficiency with Photoshop, Shopify, SEO, Adwords Familiarity with e-mail marketing applications like vertical response Interest in fashion, design, or craft production Hours: 18-25 hours/week Location: 115 W 30th Street, Suite 400, New York How to Apply: Please send resume and cover letter via email to sharrison@globalgoodspartners.org No phone calls, please. Global Goods Partners is an equal opportunity employer _________________ Global Goods Partners is a non-profit, social enterprise based in NYC that is dedicated to alleviating poverty and promoting social justice by strengthening women-led development initiatives around the world. We partner with organizations, associations, and cooperatives worldwide that integrate their commitment to community development-specifically, improvements in education, health, women’s rights, and employment opportunities-with socially responsible income-generating enterprises. We create economic opportunity by offering design direction, generating demand, and bringing the unique, handmade, and quality fashion accessories that our more than 40 partners in 22 countries produce to the U.S. and international markets through our website, www.globalgoodspartners.org.

10003.description: GO Project Spanish Translator (Saturday Volunteer) GO Project: Who We Are and What We Do The GO Project shapes the futures of low-income New York City public school children by providing critical academic, social and emotional support starting in the early elementary years. GO provides year-round educational and family support services to children who are performing below grade level and equips them with the confidence and skills needed to succeed at school, at home and in life. GO School Programming: How YOU Can Help GO School is a focused, seven-month Saturday program with a staff of certified teachers and skilled volunteer tutors. Students attend on Saturdays between October and April for a half-day of focused academic skill-building. Professional teachers lead lessons, support volunteer tutors, and communicate with parents to keep them informed about their child’s progress. Volunteer tutors commit to a semester of volunteering in a classroom and mentor their students to provide consistent and individualized needed to succeed. Volunteer translators provide critical communication support between our GO families and our staff. Interpreters are responsible for translating English into Spanish in order for our program to communicate with our families regarding program updates and their child’s academic & social-emotional progress/needs. Specific Translator duties will include: Saturdays Assist with parent meetings, workshops and orientations for Spanish speaking families. Provide interpretation for our families, including any cultural/linguistic references that may need to be explained. Maintain our families’ right to confidentiality. Collaborate with GO Staff, Volunteer Manager, Head Teachers and GO Families Staff to address and respond to our students’/ families’ needs. Time Commitment Session I: October-December 2018; 9 Saturdays from 9:00AM-12:45PM Session II: January-April 2019; 13 Saturdays from 9:00AM-12:45PM Attend mandatory orientation and training prior to start of session. *You can choose to be a Committed Volunteer to come each Saturday with 3 allowed absences per session, or a Floater Volunteer to come on the Saturdays that you are available. GO School Fall 2018 Session I Oct 13, 20, 27 Nov 3, 10, 17 Dec 1, 8, 5 GO School Spring 2019 Session II Jan 5, 12, 26 Feb 2, 9, 23 March 2, 9, 16, 23 April 6, 13, 27 Locations You can choose to tutor our students at one of the following 6 locations: Manhattan Locations Avenues: The World School (1st-3rd Grade): 259 10th Avenue, between 25th and 26th Streets Grace Church School (1st-5th Grade): 86 4th Avenue, between 10th and 11th Streets Grace Church High School (6th-8th Grade): 46 Cooper Square, at 6th Street LREI (1st-5th Grade): 272 6th Avenue, at the corner of Bleecker Street St. Luke’s School (1st-5th Grade): 487 Hudson Street, at Hudson and Christopher Streets Brooklyn Location Berkeley Carroll (1st-3rd Grade): 701 Carroll Street, between 6th and 7th Avenues Placement is based on a complimentary match between programmatic need and volunteer strengths. We will honor preferences when possible. Qualifications: Ability to speak Spanish fluently. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Interest in strength-based collaborative work, education and social services. Prior experience in simultaneous and consecutive interpretation is a plus. Personal Attributes: The ideal candidate is exceptionally intelligent, warm, engaging and energetic. He or she also: Sees the possibilities as opposed to the obstacles and is creative and tenacious in solving problems. Enjoys working with others in a collaborative, creative environment. Has a strong work ethic and high standards for his/her own work and the work of others; is flexible and has a lively sense of humor. Benefits: How Can We Help YOU Personal gratification through enhancing the lives of young learners. Ongoing professional development and training opportunities. Leadership opportunities for sustained dedication and commitment. Being part of a vibrant and diverse volunteer community. How to Apply Application Form Cover Letter/Personal Statement explaining why you want to volunteer with the GO Project Resume (for volunteers 18 and older)/ High school transcript (for HS students) Personal reference Background check (for those 18 and older) The application form for GO School 2018-2019 volunteers can be found here: https://goo.gl/forms/bkZrxbtMwZafVukT2 If you have any questions or would like more information about the available volunteer positions, please contact volunteering@goprojectnyc.org or call 347-377-2318 ATTN: Charlotte Karol, Community Engagement & Volunteer Coordinator.
10003.title: Saturday Spanish Translators Needed!

10003.description: GO Project’s GO School Saturday Volunteer Tutor GO Project: Who We Are and What We Do The GO Project shapes the futures of low-income New York City public school children by providing critical academic, social and emotional support starting in the early elementary years. GO provides year-round educational and family support services to children who are performing below grade level and equips them with the confidence and skills needed to succeed at school, at home and in life. GO School Tutoring: How YOU Can Help During the GO School Saturday program, a professional teacher models a lesson, activity, or project to a classroom of students. Volunteer tutors continue to work with small groups of 2-4 students on the lesson, providing individualized attention which allows the students to thrive. Tutor Responsibilities Tutor small group of students in grades 1st-8th who are in need of academic intervention under Head Teacher’s guidance Punctual and consistent attendance; no more than 3 absences permitted per session (Session I: October-December, Session II: January-April) Actively and enthusiastically participate - support instruction and engagement Help prepare, record, and put away classroom materials Ongoing communication with Head Teacher regarding students’ progress and/or concerns, and with the Community Engagement & Volunteer Coordinator regarding overall volunteer experience Time Commitment Session I: October-December 2018; 9 Saturdays from 9:00AM-12:45PM Session II: January-April 2019; 13 Saturdays from 9:00AM-12:45PM Attend mandatory orientation and training prior to start of session. *You can choose to be a Committed Volunteer to come each Saturday with 3 allowed absences per session, or a Floater Volunteer to come on the Saturdays that you are available. GO School Fall 2018 Session I Oct 13, 20, 27 Nov 3, 10, 17 Dec 1, 8, 5 GO School Spring 2019 Session II Jan 5, 12, 26 Feb 2, 9, 23 March 2, 9, 16, 23 April 6, 13, 27 Locations You can choose to tutor our students at one of the following 6 locations: Manhattan Locations Avenues: The World School (1st-3rd Grade): 259 10th Avenue, between 25th and 26th Streets Grace Church School (1st-5th Grade): 86 4th Avenue, between 10th and 11th Streets Grace Church High School (6th-8th Grade): 46 Cooper Square, at 6th Street LREI (1st-5th Grade): 272 6th Avenue, at the corner of Bleecker Street St. Luke’s School (1st-5th Grade): 487 Hudson Street, at Hudson and Christopher Streets Brooklyn Location Berkeley Carroll (1st-3rd Grade): 701 Carroll Street, between 6th and 7th Avenues Placement is based on a complimentary match between programmatic need and volunteer strengths. We will honor preferences when possible. Qualifications College students, professionals, retirees, and high school students in good academic standing Commitment to and belief in all children’s ability to succeed and thrive Professional work habits Benefits: How Can We Help YOU Personal gratification through enhancing the lives of young learners Ongoing professional development and training opportunities Leadership opportunities for sustained dedication and commitment Being part of a vibrant and diverse volunteer community How to Apply Application Form Cover Letter/Personal Statement explaining why you want to volunteer with GO Project Resume (for volunteers 18 and older)/High school transcript (for high school students) Personal reference Background check (for those 18 and older) The application form for GO School 2018-2019 volunteers can be found here: https://goo.gl/forms/bkZrxbtMwZafVukT2 If you have any questions or would like more information about the available volunteer positions, please contact volunteering@goprojectnyc.org or call 347-377-2318 ATTN: Charlotte Karol, Community Engagement & Volunteer Coordinator.
10003.title: Help a Child Learn to Love on Saturdays in Manhattan!

07728.description: Caregiver Volunteers of Central Jersey is now providing it's vital services in Freehold, Howell and the surrounding areas. We are specifically looking for volunteers to assist the senior community in Fair Haven, NJ. Spare an hour to take a senior to a doctor appointment? Pick up some groceries or pay a visit to a frail, homebound senior? We have immediate opportunities for people with a little or a lot of time to spare! Call 732-876-3900 or email monmouthinfo@caregivervolunteers.org today!
07728.title: Fair Haven, NJ Volunteers Needed!

06840.description: Come and play an instrument or sing to entertain our residents at Teatime.
06840.title: Bring Music to our community

10009.description: The 2018 International Human Rights Art Festival(ihraf.org), co-produced by The Wild Project (195 E. 3rd Street, Lower East Side), will take place the week of November 12- 18, 2018. This event will showcase 22 arts-advocacy events and performances oriented around human rights themes. For full information on the event, please visit our website or Facebook page ( https://www.facebook.com/HumanRightsArtFestival/) We are especially excited to extend this invitation to VolunteerMatch because of the unique chance to engage with artists, activists and politicians at a first-class NYC theater venue. Throughout the week of November 12-18, volunteers will have access to events and performances on the day(s) they volunteer (and receive a festival t-shirt!) Volunteers may sign up for as many 2-hour shifts as they like (though only one t-shirt total will be provided). We need volunteers between the following hours (we will have at least two volunteers scheduled for each slot): Monday-Friday: 11:30-1:30pm, 1:30-3:30pm, 3:30-5:30pm, 6:30-8:30pm, 8-10:30pm Saturday: 12:30-2:30pm, 2-4pm, 4-6pm, 6-8pm, 7:30-9:30pm, 9:30-11:30pm Sunday: 12:30-2:30pm, 2-4pm, 3:30-5:30pm, 5:30-7:30pm, 7-9pm, 8:30-10:30pm. Please go to https://www.signupgenius.com/go/70a0d4aaba72ea6fe3-international to sign up for your desired slot(s). We appreciate you considering this opportunity. Please feel free to share it with friends and family as well! We are also more than happy to field any questions you may have, so do not hesitate to reach out to ihrafvolunteers@gmail.com ! We look forward to seeing you and your community at the 2018 International Human Rights Art Festival!
10009.title: Volunteer for the 2018 International Human Rights Art Festival!

08901.description: Help combat community hunger at the 5 Loaves Pantry. Volunteers help unload and sort food, organize pantry items, and assist clients with shopping.
08901.title: Marketplace in New Brunswick

10475.description: New York Edge delivers afterschool programs that encourage children to play more, have fun and adopt healthy eating habits. Elect to be Fit is an annual event held on Election Day designed to build and support our students’ sports and wellness interests through friendly interscholastic competitions and sports instruction. The event will feature games, healthy snacks from our Food Explorers Program and much more! Volunteers will assist with set-up/breakdown, help out with each sports station and distribute lunch to students. Each year upwards of 200 students participate in this event and volunteers are critical to the day's success. Volunteers will be asked to dress is appropriate comfortable clothing, and wear closed-toed shoes. Lunch will be provided.
10475.title: Elect to Be Fit this Election Day!

07083.description: The Holiday season is quickly approaching and we need your help! We are asking you to join us on November 5th, 6th, and 7th from 10:00 am - 4:00 pm at 4 Gary Road, Union, NJ 07083, as we assemble red bells for a great cause! We will be assembling souvenir red bells that will be used to kick off our Red Kettle 2018 Campaign! The project involves: 1. Removing small red bell from its wrapper 2. Punching a hole into the information card 3. Attaching an information card to the red bell with a piece of ribbon 4. Curling the piece of ribbon If you’re interested and able to assist with this project please notify me by Thursday, November 1st. If you’re interested in helping but cannot assist on those particular days please give me a call at 908-851-8362. All bells must be assembled by November 16th. Thank you for your continued support and service!
07083.title: Holiday Souvenir Bell Assembly
07083.org: The Salvation Army - New Jersey Division

07083.description: Take the kettle challenge! We need your help! The Red Kettle has been part of The Salvation Army's tradition since 1891. Today, kettles are part of The Salvation Army's efforts to raise funds so critical to our on-going operations. Unfortunately for some, the holiday season can mean unmanageable expenses, disappointed children, and empty stomachs. Bellringers can work alone or in pairs, encouraging pedestrian's to contribute with ringing and friendly demeanors. Our kettle stands are \"manned\" Monday thru Saturday from early November until December 22nd. The Salvation Army will have already secured prior permission for you to stand at a designated location and all of the equipment will be provided. Only a four-hour time commitment is required and flexible hours make bell-ringing ideal for volunteers with tight schedules and families who want to share the kettle experience and help the needy. This opportunity is perfect for groups seeking a group project that will make a difference not just at this time of giving but throughout the year. Consider organizing a group from your corporation, school, service club, college, church etc that will commit to staffing a kettle for a day or more, simply rotate your members throughout the day in shifts. There will be many kettle locations throughout New Jersey, one of which I am sure will be convenient for you.
07083.title: Salvation Army bell ringer
07083.org: The Salvation Army - New Jersey Division

07087.description: Use your skills to help the immigrant community and experience the joy of helping someone change their life. We are looking for committed volunteers to teach Spanish speaking students. Volunteers teach one, three-hour class a week for ten weeks. All classes are on Sundays. Previous teaching experience is not necessary, but commitment, ability and a desire to teach are key. Our teachers have included those with experience, those undergoing teacher training and those who have no experience at all. Some classes require Spanish speakers, but some do not. Comite En Union para Salvadorenos (CEUS) is a 501 (c)3 non-profit organization based in Union City, NJ that was founded by Central American refugees to help immigrants create a better life for themselves. The classes are now offered at Centro Comunitario CEUS, our community center 15 minutes from Manhattan. Our website is www.ceusnj.org. CEUS has organized ESL classes for 23 years.
07087.title: Teach English to immigrants - change your world and theirs!

10573.description: At The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society (LLS), we're passionate about our mission: to cure leukemia, lymphoma, Hodgkin's disease and myeloma, and improve the quality of life of patients and their families. LLS volunteers help carry out this mission in so many ways: supporting patients, family members, healthcare professionals, and our community, driving policy advocacy, participating in our campaigns, and helping LLS build much needed capacity. Product information The Office of Volunteer Engagement (OVE) works to ensure that the volunteer experience across LLS is a meaningful one and that volunteers help to build capacity across the organization. Purpose The purpose of this role is to help ensure a consistent volunteer experience by creating a series of standardized role descriptions for key volunteer positions using a standardized template. Having completed and consistent role descriptions will be critical to the integration of our new volunteer management platform, Digital Cheetah. Position Tasks Using the role description template, the Program Assistant will create standardized role descriptions for each major volunteer role In some instances a current description is in place and will just need to be updated for the new template In some instances a description will have to be created from publicity and other program materials using the template to ensure consistency After drafting all the descriptions, the Program Assistant will send them to staff for review and comment, finalize the descriptions based on staff feedback, and review them for consistency. Desired Skills Volunteer should possess the following skills/qualifications: An interest in the field of volunteer engagement and/or human resources Proficient at Microsoft word Good writing and proofreading skills Attention to detail Location National Office, 3 International Drive, Suite 200 Rye Brook, NY 10573. Some work may be done remotely with either in person or phone check-ins on a weekly basis. Time Commitment This project is expected to take between 40 and 80 hours to complete and must be completed by November 5. Shift Times Flexible schedule based on mutually agreed upon times. Work must be completed during business hours 9am - 5pm. Background check required No Training LLS will provide the volunteer with an orientation to The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society including an overview of the volunteer program and introduction to the digital cheetah system. Benefits Free Parking Computer and work space provided solely for the purpose of this project Access to LLS resources (Patient Access, etc.) Opportunity to learn about an electronic volunteer management system Reference for college credit is possible. Need must be indicated at the time of volunteer interview for consideration.
10573.title: Volunteer Program Assistant

10573.description: Open Door Family Medical Center is partnering with Feeding Westchester (formerly the Food Bank of Westchester), to bring a free \"market on wheels\" to the Port Chester Community. Each month fresh, nutritious food will be provided to those-in-need. The food is set up as a farmer’s market so that people can walk through and select their own food, including fresh protein, dairy, produce and grains! Volunteers will help set up and distribute food products along with breaking down cardboard boxes. Location: Open Door Family Medical Center 5 Grace Church St, Port Chester, NY (Mobile Pantry in Parking Lot on Purdy St) Requirements: Able to lift 30 lbs. Spanish Language Skills beneficial High School Students Welcome! On-line Application Completed When: One Saturday a month August 25th, Sept. 15th, October 13th, November 10th, December 15th This is an express interest listing - a follow-up email will allow you to sign-up for available time-lots. For additional information, please contact Jane Levy, Manager of Volunteer Programs: jlevy@odfmc.org.
10573.title: FREE Nutritious Food - Help Distribute at Mobile Pantry
10573.org: Open Door Family Medical Centers Inc

10463.description: The Special Needs Program at the Kingsbridge Heights Community Center is designed to provide students with the same opportunities as all children in New York City, from fitness to creative spaces. We are looking for volunteers to help with our Respite After School Program on Mondays between the hours of 3:00 pm and 4:00 pm. The 3:00 pm - 4:00 pm would be for volunteers who are interested in running arts and crafts activities.
10463.title: Special Needs After-School Volunteer

10463.description: Position Statement: Evening classes, 6:00pm-9:30pm Monday - Thursday The ESOL (English Students of Other Languages) Program Assistant will be responsible for one-on-one support to students during classroom English lesson plans, administrative support to the instructor/s, and technical aspects of assisting students with progressing computer-based language programs. Duties and Responsibilities: Provide participants with one-on-one assistance Assist with technical and administrative tasks Provide administrative back-up and support to ESOL Instructor Engage and retain students by developing supportive relationships Other duties as assigned by Instructor Qualifications: HS Diploma; Some college preferred Comfort with computer applications and data entry Available evening hours Organized, efficient, and task oriented English/Spanish Bi-lingual helpful
10463.title: ESOL Program Volunteer

08857.description: BARK For Life of Central NJ is seeking dedicated canine loving volunteers to join our EVENT LEADERSHIP COMMITTEE and help make our 2019 BARK For Life event a big success! BARK For Life is a community based grass roots event that celebrates the special bond between people affected by cancer and their canine caregivers. Participants come together for a special event where people from all walks of life gather to walk, run and play with their dogs. There are special activities and contests for dogs as well as entertainment, a vendor fair and food trucks for all! Do you live or work in/near Central NJ area? Do you own a dog(s) or are you an animal lover? Do you have any experience with - recruiting, coaching, fundraising, community engagement, media/publicity, logistics, event planning, sales, networking, sponsorship, grassroots marketing? Have you been personally touched by cancer - through a pet, family, friend or loved one? Would you like an opportunity to meet new people/connect with your community? Are you looking for an opportunity to make a direct impact while learning new skills and/or sharing your knowledge with others? If so, then we welcome you to join our BARK For Life of Central NJ and take part in a dog walk/fundraiser to end cancer. By becoming a BARK For Life Event Leadership Volunteer, you have the opportunity to make a tangible impact in the fight against cancer, gain valuable leadership skills, and receive the honor and satisfaction of helping others in your community enjoy a memorable experience. *To learn more about how you can get involved, please contact - Vicky Allen vicky.allen@cancer.org / 732.292.4264*
08857.title: BARK For Life of Central NJ  - Join our 2019 Event Leadership Committee!

08857.description: Relay For Life of OLD BRIDGE TOWNSHIP is seeking dedicated volunteers to join our EVENT LEADERSHIP COMMITTEE and help make our 2019 Relay For Life event a big success! This year's event is slated for Saturday May 18th 2019 - 12 noon to 12 midnight at Lombardi Field in Old Bridge Township! Do you live or work in/near Old Bridge Township, NJ area? Do you have any experience with - recruiting, coaching, fundraising, community engagement, media/publicity, logistics, event planning, sales, networking, sponsorship, grassroots marketing? Have you been personally touched by cancer - through a family, friend or loved one? Would you like an opportunity to meet new people/connect with your community? Are you looking for an opportunity to make a direct impact while learning new skills and/or sharing your knowledge with others? If so, then we welcome you to join our Event Leadership Committee and be part of the world’s largest fundraising event to end cancer. By becoming a Relay For Life Event Leadership Volunteer, you have the opportunity to make a tangible impact in the fight against cancer, gain valuable leadership skills, and receive the honor and satisfaction of helping others in your community enjoy a memorable experience. *To learn more about how you can get involved, please contact - Vicky Allen vicky.allen@cancer.org / 732.292.4264*
08857.title: Relay For Life of OLD BRIDGE - Join our 2019 Event Leadership Committee!

08854.description: You are invited to a free Hospice Volunteer Orientation on Friday, Nov. 16, 9:30am - 2:30pm, Kindred Hospice, 242 Old New Brunswick Rd, Piscataway, NJ. 08854 . Gain valuable knowledge on how you can use your gift of compassion to provide friendly visits to patients with life-limiting illnesses so that they can live out their days as comfortably as possible. Visits are provided wherever the patient calls home in the central NJ area. Students in the healthcare, psychology or social work field are encouraged to attend. Administrative volunteers are needed to help in our Piscataway office. To sign up for this free orientation or get more information on the volunteer opportunity contact the Manager of Volunteer Services at Elaine.Carlsen@KindredHospice.com or call 732-562-8800.
08854.title: Hospice Volunteer Orientation: Nov 16

11226.description: Providing Legal Permanent Residents (LPRs) a transparent pathway to Naturalization. Who: Volunteer (you) What: Through this opportunity, you will lead/assist with the instruction of LPRs in preparation to apply and become a Naturalized U.S. Citizen. We will attain this goal by utilizing Civics materials provided by USCIS and through your engagement of creating weekly lesson plans directing the topics of the week. Duties: Creation and teaching of weekly lesson plans 4/5 Assessments of Clients knowledge through this class 1/2 Mock Interview with Clients Participation in our Naturalization Workshop - providing clients and the community with free legal support in creating their N400 Application Reliable and Responsible When: Duration: 12 Weeks (Aug 18 - Nov 3) Time: 9am - 1:30pm (Saturday Commitment) Size: ~15 clients Where: Holy Innocents R.C. Church (Brooklyn, NY 11226) Why: Many legal green card holders are taken advantage of by outside organizations, paying outlandish fees and receive no results. Through our class we are providing Application for Naturalization help through a BIA Accredited lawyer and through our class, you will aid clients in understanding U.S. History and Civics. **Through our prior classes we have aided over 15 clients to become a Naturalized citizen with the help of completing their Application for Naturalization (N400), Civics and Citizenship Class, and Case Management. DLM (501c3): https://www.dlm.ngo/citizenship USCIS Resource: https://www.uscis.gov/citizenship Interested in this opportunity? Send your resume to \" contact@dlm.ngo\" Subject \"Volunteer - Pathway to Naturalization\" A member of our team will follow up with you.
11226.title: DLM: Teach Civics and Citizenship (to LPRs in Brooklyn)

06906.description: The mission of Caring Hospice Services is to coordinate patient and services while respecting their choices, values and beliefs. Veteran volunteers are needed who also have military experience to provide camaraderie, companionship and hope to our patients, and their families, who have served our country through military service. Caring Hospice of Connecticut has patients throughout Western Connecticut who are in need of friendly visits from individuals willing to give few hours a month. Out patients reside in private homes, skilled nursing and assisted living facilities throughout Fairfield County. Veteran Volunteers are crucial in fulfilling the hospice mission, in a wide variety of ways: Assist Veteran patients in reminiscing/telling life stories. Educate and assist patients with receiving Veteran benefits. Take part in pinning ceremonies, distribute certificates for Veteran observed holidays. Assist in replacing lost medals or other recognition ribbons. Individualized training is provided free of charge without the need to travel to our Stamford office. In keeping Medicare requirements, background and medical checks are part of the training.
06906.title: Veteran Volunteer

06902.description: The perfect holiday family volunteer activity! The annual Domus Holiday Mall is a special day for our parents to \"shop\" for their children in a loving, safe environment--without feeling like they are being given a handout. And because every youth is known to the staff, the gifts we ask for match the desire of young hearts. It's a remarkable day and experience. From helping our families shop, to wrapping gifts, over 300 volunteers make the day special. And if you want to bring a home made treat for our cafe or a pile of large clothing store shopping bags for the wrapped presents--we'd be thrilled! Free childcare for youth 9 and under. The 2:15 hour volunteer shifts begin at 8:45a.
06902.title: Elves Needed for our 10th Annual Domus Holiday Mall

06903.description: Assistant Treasurer with the following duties: Reviews weekly cash deposits Receive, organize and pay bills Input accounting activity into Quickbooks Closing accounting books on monthly, quarterly and annual basis Organizing and archiving financial records Hours are flexible: Thursday, Fridays & Saturdays between 10:00 and 12:00 If you fit the bill and would like to help us, please get in touch with me. Thanks for your interest! Tom Porter Volunteer Coordinator - Board Member Stamford History Center 1508 High Ridge Road Stamford, CT 06903 www.stamfordhistory.org volunteer@stamfordhistory.org (O) 203-329-1183 (C) 917-701-3572
06903.title: Assistant Treasurer / Bookeeper

06903.description: Media/News Writer Volunteer, If you enjoy writing, this is the volunteer job for you. We are looking for someone to create press releases about the Stamford History Center for distribution to various media outlets (onlinenews sites, radio, tv, magazines, etc.). You will interview people in the organization to gather information. Once your article is reviewed by our volunteer editors, it will be sent out. It is essential that our media volunteer stays up-to- date with our activities, so press releases go out in a timely fashion. The position can be expanded to include the creation of newsletters and flyers (working with our graphic designer). This is a job that can be done largely from your own laptop/desktop, and at your own convenience. REQUIREMENT: Please write a two or three paragraph \"Press Release\" on one of the following topics: 1] About our Tag Sale 2] The opening of the Hoyt-Barnum House or 3] A past Historical Center event You can get ideas by going to our web site: www.stamfordhistory.org Forward it to me and we will review and get back to you. Thanks again for your interest in joining the volunteer team! Tom Tom Porter Volunteer Coordinator Stamford History Center 1508 High Ridge Road Stamford, CT 06903 www.stamfordhistory.org 203-329-1183 Skills needed: organized, experienced writer; a self-starter who can use Word and navigate the internet.
06903.title: Media/News Writer Volunteer

06903.description: Volunteer Help Wanted: Dynamic Education Program Docents! The Stamford Historical Society is looking for dedicated, enthusiastic and energetic individuals to staff its extremely successful education programs. If you enjoy working with children, want to share your enthusiasm for history, or are looking to broaden your own experience, becoming an Education Docent for the Stamford History Center is an excellent opportunity. Teaching experience is helpful, but not required. Docents will bring in classroom programs into elementary schools during the school year and host onsite programs at the Stamford History Center. All docents will be trained to lead our hands-on programs in a series of workshops. Programs take place on school days. The specific days and dates and hours will be confirmed with the school participants. PLEASE RESPOND via this site and we will get back to you. Thanks for your interest!
06903.title: School Outreach and Docent for Dynamic Education Program

06903.description: Welcome Visitors to the Museum; answer questions about Exhibits; respond to Phone Inquiries. Docent training provided at the start of each new exhibit. Time Commitment: Minimum 3 hours per week, during Museum hours. This is an especially good volunteer opportunity for students both during summer vacation time as well as fulfilling their school community service requirements.This position can be filled by students giving one Saturday afternoon a month to the Society. Seniors looking to meet new people and continue learning about their community have found this to be an interesting way to accomplish those goals. We are flexible in that volunteers can come in weekly or biweekly depending on their schedules.
06903.title: Docent / Tour Guide - Hoyt-Barnum House

06901.description: Stamford Academy serves about 135 high school students who have been unsuccessful in other schools. The number of students with Individual Education Plans (IEPs) is about twice the rate of Stamford Public Schools, yet Stamford is able to provide only one SPED teacher. You know how important one-on-one instruction is. Do you have a couple of hours to spare once a week during the school year to help tutor a student? Training provided. To meet our kids is to love them. They are wary and giving; have big dreams and struggle to stay on task; are talented and funny; and may have not had dinner the night before. If you'd like to know more, please contact me.
06901.title: Do you know what an IEP is? If so, read on...

10466.description: We are currently looking for writing/literary arts teachers for our literary programs. Words vs. Pictures: This is our visual and literary arts program and you may spend some time throughout the year working with an artist/teaching artist. You will have the opportunity to create your curriculum to teach our students different writing disciplines and engage them in projects related to self-expression/exploration, current events, and other subjects of interest. You will work with the students to create works suitable for a show/exhibit at the end of the year. Bookworms: This is our book club for young readers. The club meets once per month during the school year. Read thrilling books and do fun activities with elementary school aged children to build their love of reading. Beyond Words: This book club is for teens. The club meets once per month during the school year. Engage middle and high school students in reading books with themes relevant to today's events. We are looking for writers/teachers that can teach various literary arts disciplines - poetry, short essay, biography, etc. Please contact us whether you are interested in teaching for the whole school year, a semester, or a particular subject/discipline for a limited time. We are open to the right teacher or combination of teachers. At Artsmith, we are dedicated to providing arts education to young people in the Bronx who have little or no opportunity to experience the arts. We know that the arts provide our students with a great and safe place to learn creativity, experiment and take risks, develop discipline, and build confidence. Arts education should not be a question of access. You must believe in this mission to volunteer with us! Email resume to tricia.smith@artsmith.org to be considered.
10466.title: Writing/Literary Arts Teacher

10467.description: I'RAISE Offers an exciting and rewarding opportunity to individuals seeking to become a role model and make a positive impact on younger youth. This exciting opportunity includes one on one mentoring, group mentoring and/or mentoring. Mentors work with mentees on developing goals for their life that will help them make social, emotional and educational gains! Ideal candidates include college students. students who need internship experience/volunteer experience, retired professionals or individuals who simply want to make a difference! If you are seeking an opportunity to invest in a youth and make a positive difference.
10467.title: Big Brother/Big Sister Mentor

11553.description: This is our 3rd Annual Charity Ball Event, We are looking for volunteers to help us organize, set up, greeting and seating our guests. Also helping with serving food and drinking.
11553.title: M4Haiti 2018 Charity Ball

10462.description: Art Day is an annual New York Edge event of visual & performing arts designed to build self- confidence and empowerment through art workshops. This year's theme is Pathways to Success: Technology & the Arts. 300 students K-12 from schools around the five New York City boroughs will participate. Volunteers will assist with set up, T-shirt distribution, help students with their transitions, serve as time keepers for workshops, set up cafeteria, distribute lunch, assist with lining students to the stage for the culminating performance, and assist with clean up at end of the day Volunteers should dress comfortably and wear closed-toed shoes. Lunch is provided. There will be morning and afternoon shifts available. Morning Shift: 8:30am-12:00pm Afternoon Shift: 12:00pm-4pm
10462.title: Art Day

10462.description: Hello! We are a family-run charity English school based in China's Dragon City. If you're aiming to make a difference, travel or are taking a gap year then we might just be what you're looking for. We are searching for enthusiastic people to come and join us immediately as teachers. No experience as a teacher is required, just a positive attitude, a love for working with children and a desire to see more of the world! Through local funding we are excited to be able to provide 4 people from the US or UK paid volunteer positions and the chance to come and work with us for 6-12 months and really make a difference, not just in our local community, but all over the world through the work we do. We Provide: - 4 day working week, with 3 days off each week to travel China (we offer a weekly itinerary of different places to visit) - 4000rmb monthly allowance for travel and food - Free return flight home (or to your next adventure) for those who are able to stay for 12 months - Free Chinese lessons 4 times a week - Free use of school bikes and scooters - Accommodation with kitchen, bathroom, bedroom, wifi, electricity and gas bills all included - Provided meals on weekend days - Full teacher training - Invitations to random fun activities (BBQ's, Kayaking etc...) and visits to local towns and places of interest In return you'll be helping both the local and international English teaching community through a variety of jobs, including (but not limited to) teaching English classes, the creation of fun English speaking games, field trips, cooking classes, elderly home visits, community inclusion activities (free pancake offering on the street, line dancing with local \"aunties\", movie nights, story telling and much more!) and a whole host of other things! If you are interested please see our website www.dandaschool.com for more information or apply here with a copy of you CV, accompanied by a paragraph introducing yourself and explaining why you would like to come. Please add any questions you may have for us the application and we'll be happy to answer. We are looking for people to start before the school year begins (September 1st), as such, the interview process is quick with all initial successful applications given a Skype interview, with decisions made within a few days. Thank you so much for your time, please share on your Facebook or other social media if you think you have a friend who might be interested! Kind Regards, Dec & Any The D and A in D&A
10462.title: Want a Genuinely Wonderful China Experience? Join D&A Charity School and Become an English Teacher

11554.description: T he Long Island Friends of People With AIDS in conjunction with Nassau University Medical Center joyously announce our Thirty-First Annual Thanksgiving Dinner Celebration Visit. We will be visiting people with HIV/AIDS and other patients on Sunday the 18th of November from 3:00 pm to 5:30 pm. The purpose of this event is to be with and bring cheer to patients, and to raise the awareness of the AIDS crisis. Complimentary Thanksgiving Dinner for All If you need more information, please feel free to call me at 516-445-2093. Thanks........Allan
11554.title: LONG ISLAND FRIENDS OF PEOPLE WITH AIDS THANKSGIVING VISIT

10460.description: Artsmith is a young nonprofit providing arts programming to children in the Bronx. We are currently looking for artists and/or teaching artists for various programs and events our organization runs. Words vs. Pictures: Words vs. Pictures is our visual and literary arts program serving elementary and middle school students. The program is designed to teach students ways to express themselves and explore important topics using various writing and art methods. We are looking for artists/teaching artists that can teach one or more visual arts disciplines - drawing/sketching, painting, photography, sculpture, etc. The program meets once per week on Saturday afternoons. Contact us whether you'd like to teach a single class or make a longer commitment. Paint and Sip: Our paint and sips are fundraisers that are held at local Bronx breweries or restaurants. If you are a painter interested in leading these events please contact us. We will provide the necessary materials for the participants. At Artsmith, we are dedicated to providing arts education to young people in the Bronx who have little or no opportunity to experience the arts. We know that the arts provide our students with a great and safe place to learn creativity, experiment and take risks, develop discipline, and build confidence. Arts education should not be a question of access. You must believe in this mission to volunteer with us! Email resume and 2-3 art samples to tricia.smith@artsmith.org.
10460.title: Artist/Teaching Artist

10461.description: Our volunteer Board of Directors is largely comprised of persons who have clinical and social service experience. For example, current board members include psychiatrists, psychologists and social workers. No current board members have a background in law, fundraising, marketing & development, human resources, accounting or finance. We are looking expand our board as well as it's professional diversity by adding 3-5 individuals with the aforementioned credentials. Specific governing body needs include a Treasurer and Secretary to serve as officers. Individual(s) with law, human resource or fundraising experience will serve as Board Directors. Although Pibly is motivated to enter into fundraising, monetary contributions from its board members is not required. Our Board of Directors meetings are held quarterly at our north Bronx Main office.
10461.title: Board positions including Treasurer, Secretary & Directors

07470.description: Almost 300 children in the Passaic County foster care system are without a compassionate volunteer advocate. At this hour-long, no commitment volunteer information session, you will learn about the Passaic County Court Appointed Special Advocates (CASA) volunteer program and how you can make a difference in the lives of Passaic County children in foster care. CASA volunteers are trained, dedicated adults who look out for a child's best interests while helping him or her move toward a safe and permanent home. CASAs have been best described as the \"eyes and ears\" of the Family Court. From helping siblings find permanent homes together to helping a child access needed services to uncovering information that helps reunite a loving family, CASA volunteers make an incredible difference to the lives of abused and neglected children. Come join us and learn more! Please RSVP here: http://www.passaiccountycasa.org/orientation/. For more information, call Jessica at 973-832-4002, ext. 201 or e-mail Jessica@passaiccountycasa.org.
07470.title: Become a superhero for children in foster care
07470.org: CASA for Children of Passaic County

Starts in mid September and ends with a 5K on December 2nd. You do not need to run to coach with this program. Please see our website for more info www.gotrlongisland.org

07095.description: Relay For Life of WOODBRIDGE TOWNSHIP is seeking dedicated volunteers to join our EVENT LEADERSHIP COMMITTEE and help make our 2019 Relay For Life event a big success! Do you live or work in/near Woodbridge Township, NJ area? Do you have any experience with - recruiting, coaching, fundraising, community engagement, media/publicity, logistics, event planning, sales, networking, sponsorship, grassroots marketing? Have you been personally touched by cancer - through a family, friend or loved one? Would you like an opportunity to meet new people/connect with your community? Are you looking for an opportunity to make a direct impact while learning new skills and/or sharing your knowledge with others? If so, then we welcome you to join our Event Leadership Committee and be part of the world’s largest fundraising event to end cancer. By becoming a Relay For Life Event Leadership Volunteer, you have the opportunity to make a tangible impact in the fight against cancer, gain valuable leadership skills, and receive the honor and satisfaction of helping others in your community enjoy a memorable experience. *To learn more about how you can get involved, please contact - Vicky Allen - vicky.allen@cancer.org / 732.292.4264*
07095.title: Relay For Life of Woodbridge Township - Join our Event Leadership Committee!
